newsitem.title: DOMINICAN REPUBLIC: New Dominican president plans few economic changes.
newsitem.headline: New Dominican president plans few economic changes.

text.p: The newly installed government of the Dominican Republic said on Wednesday that it did not plan sigificant changes in the nation's basic economic policy from that of its predecessor, ratifying Hector Valdez Albizu as governor of the Central Bank.
A spokesman for President Leonel Fernandez, who was inaugurated last Friday, said the ratification of of Valdez Albizu, "maintains a policy that guarantees macroeconomic stability."

Valdez Albizu was appointed on August 31, 1994, by the government of then-president Joaquin Balaguer. During his term, the Dominican Republic's economy has been one of the soundest in Latin America. Economic growth was 5.7 percent during the first months of 1996.
